alert.note: Alert for Houston; Humphreys; Montgomery; Robertson; Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 6:01AM CST until February 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Houston, Humphreys, Montgomery, Robertson and Stewart. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 601 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Rainfall rates across the area are quite high and rainfall amounts will add up quickly as multiple storms move over the advisory area throughout the morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clarksville, Camden, Dover, Erin, New Johnsonville, Tennessee Ridge, Big Rock, Adams, Cumberland City, Indian Mound, Palmyra, Woodlawn, Houston County Airport, Cunningham and Land Between The Lakes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
